intro: Schmidtottia cubensis var. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban Schmidtottia, is a species of flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms and cycads. The plant is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and pinnately compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical climates and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The flowers are small and clustered, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
